member.name: T:org.openoces.ooapi.certificate.OcesCertificateFactory
member.summary: Factory able to create an OcesCertificate.

member.name: M:org.openoces.ooapi.certificate.OcesCertificateFactory.Generate(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2})
member.summary:
Generates an OcesCertificate. The returned OcesCertificate is the end user certificate, which has a parent relation to the certificate of its issuing CA which again can have a parent relation to the certificate of the root CA. The root CA has no parent relation.
The factory verifies that each certificate in the certificate chain has been signed by its issuing CA.
member.param: List of certificates to create OcesCertificate chain from.
member.returns: OcesCertificate with parent relation to (chain of) issuing CAs. Depending on the Subject DN in the certificate a PocesCertificate, MocesCertificate, VocesCertificate, or FocesCertificate will be created.
member.exception: when a OcesCertificate in the chain cannot be trusted, i.e. has not been signed by its issuing CA.

member.name: M:org.openoces.ooapi.certificate.OcesCertificateFactory.SortCertificatesIssuerLast(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2})
member.summary: Find all certificates that are not self-signed and has key usage "digital signature". Then sort all certificates, so that issuers are after the certificates they sign. Certificates in the list that were not part of the trust chain for the digital signatures are not retained.
member.returns: sorted certificates needed to verify the digital signatures from the input list

member.name: P:org.openoces.ooapi.certificate.OcesCertificateFactory.Instance
member.summary: Gives the singleton instance.

member.name: T:org.openoces.securitypackage.LogonHandler
member.summary: This class handles validation and extraction of person ID from the output data provided by the Open Logon applet.

member.name: M:org.openoces.securitypackage.LogonHandler.ValidateAndExtractPid(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Given the output data from the Open Logon applet, the person ID (pid) is extracted if the login data is valid.
member.param: the output data from the Open Logon applet.

expected value of the signature parameter logonto for OCESI applet responses or of the signature parameter RequestIssuer for OCESII applet responses. Can be set to null if validation should not be performed (this is not recommended).
member.returns: the pid of the certificate that is used for logging in. Only valid pids are returned.
member.throws: ServiceProviderException in case that no pid can be extracted from the data provided.
AppletException in case the applet returned an error code.

member.name: M:org.openoces.securitypackage.LogonHandler.ValidateSignatureAndExtractCertificate(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Given the output data from the Open Logon applet, the certificate is extracted if the login data is valid. NB! The validity of the certificate is *NOT* checked (i.e. it is not checked if the certificate is valid, invalid, revoked, not yet valid or expired)
member.param: the output data from the Open Logon applet.

expected value of the signature parameter logonto for OCESI applet responses or of the signature parameter RequestIssuer for OCESII applet responses. Can be set to null if validation should not be performed (this is not recommended).
member.returns: the certificate that is used for logging in.

member.name: M:org.openoces.securitypackage.LogonHandler.ValidateAndExtractCertificateAndStatus(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Given the output data from the Open Logon applet, the certificate extracted if the login data is valid. The status of the certificate is checked and a the certificate and its status is returned wrapped in a CertificateStatus instance.
member.param: the output data from the Open Logon applet.

expected value of the signature parameter logonto for OCESI applet responses or of the signature parameter RequestIssuer for OCESII applet responses. Can be set to null if validation should not be performed (this is not recommended).
member.returns: the certificate that is used for logging in and the status of this certificate (wrapped in a CertificateStatus instance)

member.name: T:org.openoces.securitypackage.PersonId
member.summary: Models the ID of a person also known as the PID. The PID is part of a Personal OCES (POCES) certificate (danish: borgercertifikat).

member.name: T:org.openoces.securitypackage.SignatureValidationStatus
member.summary: Signature validation result.

member.name: T:org.openoces.securitypackage.SignHandler
member.summary: This class handles validation and extraction of person ID from the output data provided by the Open Sign applet.

members.member:
Given the output data from the Open Sign applet, signed text is extracted if the login data is valid.
the output data from the Open Sign applet (base64 encoded). the string to match against the signed text in the login data. expected value of the signature parameter logonto for OCESI applet responses or of the signature parameter RequestIssuer for OCESII applet responses. Can be set to null if validation should not be performed (this is not recommended). true if the signed text matches the agreement parameter AppletException in case the applet returned an error code.

member.summary: This method verifies a certificate by calling the OCSP used in current Environment
member.returns: true if certificate is revoked else false

member.returns: true if a connection can be made

member.name: M:org.openoces.serviceprovider.ConfigurationChecker.CanCallOcsp(System.String)
member.summary: This method calls the OCSP configured for current Environment. This method further validate the root certificate against the OCSP.
member.returns: true if call went well, else false

member.name: T:org.openoces.serviceprovider.EnvironmentTester
member.summary: Use the Main method of this Class to test if the Environment has been setup correctly.

member.name: M:org.openoces.serviceprovider.EnvironmentTester.Main(System.String[])
member.summary: Tests if the environment has been setup correctly.

member.name: T:org.openoces.serviceprovider.ServiceProviderSetup
member.summary:
High-level set-up of the environment. This class is used for setting the CRL revocation checker, the environment that the system is used in, and the certificate used to communicate with the PID service.
The default settings are:
Revocation checking is done using partitioned CRLs.
The OCES-II production environment is used.

member.name: M:org.openoces.serviceprovider.ServiceProviderSetup.SetOcspRevocationChecker
member.summary: Instructs OOAPI to check revocation of certificates using OCSP.

member.name: M:org.openoces.serviceprovider.ServiceProviderSetup.SetFullCrlRevocationChecker
member.summary: Instructs OOAPI to check revocation of certificates by downloading the full CRL.

member.name: M:org.openoces.serviceprovider.ServiceProviderSetup.SetPartitionedCrlRevocationChecker
member.summary: Instructs OOAPI to check revocation of certificates by downloading partial CRLs. This is the default.

member.name: M:org.openoces.serviceprovider.ServiceProviderSetup.SetEnvironmentToOcesIiProduction
member.summary: Sets the environment to OCES-II production. This is the default.

member.name: M:org.openoces.serviceprovider.ServiceProviderSetup.SetEnvironmentToOcesIiExternalTest
member.summary: Sets the environment to OCES-II external test.

member.name: M:org.openoces.serviceprovider.ServiceProviderSetup.CreatePidServiceClient
member.summary: Creates a new PID service client for the current environment.

member.name: P:org.openoces.serviceprovider.ServiceProviderSetup.CurrentChecker
member.summary: Gets the current checker.

member.name: T:org.openoces.serviceprovider.ServiceProviderException
member.summary: General checked exception thrown from the Service Provider Package when something fails
